txt.en: You have chosen to compete in a competition to help determine the best forester in all of Chetwood - right now. Speak to the judge to let them know that you are ready to compete.

'An effort for the ages, [placeholder]. We will remember your efforts here today and speak of them in this lumberyard for a good long time to come. Take this justly earned reward. You have made yourself and all foresters proud this day!'
Do not drop the caber
'Well done, [placeholder]. I am very impressed with your prowess, and you should be, too. You are welcome to return any time and entertain the masses.'

'We will need you to wait for the next round of the competition; but, fear not, we will ensure that these happen as quickly as we can start and finish them. While others are competing, perhaps you can watch them and learn some tips for your own competition.'
Do not drop the caber

'Hmm, allow me a moment to look these over.'

She pauses.

'These are acceptable. Now, make your way behind my father's home and skin the bears there. When you have collected five skins go and tan them, then bring me the resulting items.'
'Hurry along now. Refine the skins at the hide stretchers on the far side of the camp.'

'Yes, yes, it appears that you are at least nominally skilled with a skinning knife and hide stretcher. On to the next part of the competition: the feat of fortitude and strength!'

She flashes a broad smile.

'Sample beverages from the table beside my father's home and then collect a caber. Carry the caber through the red flags around the camp and finish at the blue flags!

'The first one through shall be declared the winner!'
Carry the caber through the blue markers

You dropped the caber

'Hullo there, have you come to compete in the contest?' 

Wilkin smiles broadly. 

'What contest, you ask? The one to determine who the finest forester in the Chetwood is, of course! Naturally, you will need have the forester profession to compete.' 

'Aldith and I thought it would be a fine way to settle the matter of who is best, seeing as how you foresters always seem to be arguing about such over a pint of ale. 

'To properly settle the matter with deeds instead of just boasts, it must be a contest of the strength, the dexterity, and even the fortitude of the competing foresters. And then there has to be prizes for the winners and those that compete, as would be expected. 

'If you think you are up to the challenge, or at least take a liking to the prizes, just tell me so! Then you will want to see Aldith to register, and in a short time we can get started.'
Markers passed
You dropped the caber
Markers passed
You dropped the caber

'Another contestant?

'It warms my heart to see so many seeking the noble profession of forestry. I have entered you in my log.'

She chuckles.

'Now, let's see who else wants to register. Stay close by, and I will let you know when it is time to begin.'
You dropped the caber
'Go! Collect your axes and start crafting!'
